result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory R Flisakowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DNA Surcharge and Pay Costs.
Any cash bond's are to be applied to fine's and costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory R Flisakowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Early Discharge from Probation /s/ RJS 04/20/17

Defendant Cory R Flisakowski in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF355 and 14CF434.

2:34 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Neither party has corrections to the PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing and states this on the record.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing and states this on the record.
2:54 p.m.  Defendant makes a statement prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CF355:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
Placed on probation for 3 years
Conditional jail of 180 days in County Jail  with Huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work and aoda/mental health treatment
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date 
Pay fine of $1,800.00 plus costs
Pay blood draw of $26.45
36 month DL revocation, Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
36 month IID on any vehicles title, operated or owned in the defendant's name effective today's date
Aoda assessment and comply with recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPASS assessment and the Department of Corrections.


Count 2 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

14CF434:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
Probation 3 years to run concurrent to 13CF355
Comply with conditions on 13CF355
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Costs 

**Any cash bond's are to be applied to fine's and costs
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on March 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cory R Flisakowski in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:31 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins makes statements.  Matter was originally set for sentencing.  Between the time the PSI was ordered and today's hearing, the department did not have enough time to complete the PSI.  Asks for a new date.  The department is aware this date was changed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Status conference on January 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.
Court accepts the pleas.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Cory R Flisakowski in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:06 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a waiver. 

 Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Cory R Flisakowski appeared by video.  Attorney  Jared Redfield appeared by phone for Defendant Cory R Flisakowski. Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth Constable appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Redfield makes statements to the Court. 
Court reviews the file. 
Court questions Atty Redfield. 
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Court notes there is a $500 cash bond with conditions in this case.  
BY THE COURT:  Warrant is vacated.  
State does not object to the reinstatement of the bond. 

BY THE COURT:  Court reinstates the bond and the defendant can be released.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant Cory R Flisakowski not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court.  He may be in custody.  BTC:  Warrant authorized.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Comply with day report requirements that he is currently under.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping - Felony.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent/make a statement.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements re: bond. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/17/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
